p: As a preliminary step, the antibacterial activity of the essential oils was determined by the disk diffusion method, following the Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute guidelines (CLSI VET01‐A4, 2013) for the disk diffusion test with antibiotics, including the modifications proposed for essential oils (Huerta et al., 2016). Briefly, from an overnight culture, a suspension of 1.5 × 10 8 CFU·ml −1 was prepared in sterile saline solution, and inoculated onto a plate of MHA with 5% defibrinated sheep blood. A sterile 6 mm diameter white disk (Oxoid Ltd, ES), previously impregnated with 15 μl of pure essential oil, was placed onto every plate and once sealed with parafilm, plates were incubated in a 5% CO 2‐enriched atmosphere at 35°C for 20–24 hr.
